base_note.note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-07-04
Patient: David Kim | MRN: 4517051 | Age: 45M
Attending: Dr. Nancy Adams, MD
Location: Northwestern Memorial Hospital, Chicago, IL

INDICATION: Immunocompromised patient (AML s/p allo-HSCT day +45) with new bilateral infiltrates on CT, febrile, hypoxic. BAL for infectious workup.

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with BAL

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation (intubated in MICU, FiO2 60%)

PROCEDURE: Bronchoscope advanced via ETT. Airways examined:
- Diffuse mucosal edema and erythema throughout
- Scant mucopurulent secretions
- No endobronchial lesions

BAL performed in RML (area of maximal infiltrate on CT):
- Instilled 150mL sterile saline in 3 aliquots
- Returned 60mL slightly cloudy fluid
- Sent for: Cell count, bacterial/fungal/viral cultures, PCP DFA, CMV PCR, galactomannan, respiratory viral panel, cytology

SPECIMENS: BAL fluid - comprehensive infectious workup

COMPLICATIONS: Transient desaturation to 88% during procedure, resolved with increased FiO2

IMPRESSION: BAL obtained for infectious workup in immunocompromised host. Await results.

Dr. Nancy Adams, MD

code_rationales.31624: BAL for infection workup in immunocompromised patient.

coding_review.overall_assessment: BAL-only procedure appropriate for pneumonia workup.

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Deborah Lopez
Medical Record Number: 4994731
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-06-30

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with immunocompromised - pneumonia workup. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Bal:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in standardized fashion with sequential aliquot instillation and aspiration to optimize cellular yield. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31624

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-06-22
Patient: Anna Cook
MRN: 9260229
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Immunocompromised - pneumonia workup

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Bal performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
BAL fluid - comprehensive infectious workup

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
ICU

CPT CODES: 31624

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-08-09, Carol Cox, a None-year-old patient (MRN 1809795), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Immunocompromised - pneumonia workup. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included bronchoalveolar lavage for microbiological and cytological analysis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is infectious - pending. 

Procedural coding: 31624.
